contentrichtext.text: {{about|the administrative region in Greece|other uses|Macedonia (disambiguation)|and|Thrace (disambiguation)}} {{pp-move-indef|small=yes}} {{Infobox settlement | name = East Macedonia and Thrace | type = [[Modern regions of Greece|Region of Greece]] | native_name = {{lang|el|Περιφέρεια Ανατολικής Μακεδονίας<br />και Θράκης}} | image = | image_map = Periferia_Anatolikis_Makedonias_ke_Thrakis.png | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = {{flag|Greece}} | leader_title = Regional governor | leader_name = Aristeidis Giannakidis | leader_party = [[Panhellenic Socialist Movement|PASOK]] | parts_type = [[Regional units of Greece|Regional units]] | parts_style = list | p1 = [[Drama (regional unit)|Drama]] | p2 = [[Evros (regional unit)|Evros]] | p3 = [[Kavala (regional unit)|Kavala]] | p4 = [[Rhodope (regional unit)|Rhodope]] | p5 = [[Thasos]] | p6 = [[Xanthi (regional unit)|Xanthi]] | seat_type = Capital | seat = [[Komotini]] | population_total = 608182 | population_as_of = 2011 | area_total_km2 = 14157 | population_density_km2 = auto | iso_code = GR-A | website = [http://pamth.gov.gr pamth.gov.gr] | latd = 41.2 | longd = 25.0 | coordinates_display = yes }} '''East Macedonia and Thrace''' ({{lang-el|Ανατολική Μακεδονία και Θράκη}}, formally {{lang|el|Περιφέρεια Ανατολικής Μακεδονίας και Θράκης}}) is one of the thirteen [[Modern regions of Greece|regions]] of [[Greece]]. It consists of the northeastern parts of the country, comprising the eastern part of the [[regions of Greece|region]] of [[Macedonia (Greece)|Macedonia]] along with the region of [[Western Thrace|Thrace]], and the islands of [[Thasos]] and [[Samothrace]]. == Administration == East Macedonia and Thrace was established in the 1987 administrative reform. With the 2010 [[Kallikratis plan]], its powers and authority were redefined and extended. Along with [[Central Macedonia]], it is supervised by the [[Decentralized Administration of Macedonia and Thrace]] based at [[Thessaloniki]]. The region is based at [[Komotini]] and the largest city is [[Kavala]]. It is divided into the Macedonian [[regional units of Greece|regional units]] of [[Drama (regional unit)|Drama]], [[Kavala (regional unit)|Kavala]] and [[Thasos]] and the Thracian regional units of [[Xanthi (regional unit)|Xanthi]], [[Rhodope (regional unit)|Rhodope]] and [[Evros (regional unit)|Evros]]. Before the Kallikratis reform, the regional units (except Thasos, which was part of Kavala) were administered as separate [[prefectures of Greece|prefectures]]. Since 1994, they were grouped into the [[Drama-Kavala-Xanthi Super-prefecture|Drama-Kavala-Xanthi]] and [[Rhodope-Evros Super-prefecture|Rhodope-Evros]] [[super-prefecture]]s. The region's governor is, since 1 January 2011, [[Aristeidis Giannakidis]], who was elected in the [[Greek local elections, 2010|November 2010 local administration elections]] for the [[Panhellenic Socialist Movement]]. ==Major communities== *[[Alexandroupoli|Alexandroúpoli (Αλεξανδρούπολη)]] - 65.894 people *[[Drama, Greece|Dráma (Δράμα)]] - 56.062 people *[[Kavala|Kavála (Καβάλα)]] - 74.186 people *[[Komotini|Komotiní (Κομοτηνή)]] - 66.580 people *[[Xanthi|Xánthi (Ξάνθη)]] - 55.360 people ==External links== {{commonscat|East Macedonia and Thrace}} *[http://www.pamth.gov.gr/ East Macedonia and Thrace region] {{Kallikratis-East Macedonia and Thrace}} {{Greek Macedonia}} {{Peripheries of Greece}} [[Category:East Macedonia and Thrace| ]] [[Category:Macedonia (Greece)]] [[Category:NUTS 2 statistical regions of the European Union]] [[Category:States and territories established in 1987]]
